title: EPIC: Trading Management Consolidation
description: Consolidate 7 fragmented trading addons into unified Trading Management Addon with modular architecture. Goal: Better UX (tabbed interface), code reuse (30% reduction), clear pipeline (data → analysis → execution).
notes: CHECKPOINT 60%: 6/10 phases complete in 4.5 hours. Core functionality migrated (data, analysis, risk, execution, copy trading). Remaining: UI consolidation, backtesting, testing, deprecation. All migrations created (14 tables), 12 models, 9 services. mtapi.io integration operational. System ready for testing.

title: Phase 1: Foundation - Create addon structure and shared contracts
description: Create trading-management-addon structure, implement shared contracts (DataProviderInterface, ExchangeAdapterInterface), traits (HasEncryptedCredentials, ConnectionHealthCheck), DTOs, events, and module registration system. Set up unified routes and menu structure.

title: Phase 10: Deprecation & Migration - Deprecate old addons
description: Mark old 7 addons as deprecated. Provide database migration scripts. Create user migration guide with video tutorials. Provide backward compatibility layer. Grace period with both UIs. Cleanup old addon code after migration complete.

title: Phase 2: Data Layer - Implement data-provider and market-data modules
description: Create data-provider module with MtapiAdapter and CcxtAdapter. Implement market-data module with centralized MarketDataService (with caching), FetchMarketDataJob, BackfillHistoricalDataJob. Migrate market data logic from filter-strategy-addon.
notes: Phase 2 80% complete: Migrations (3), Models (3), mtapi.io Adapter, Services (2), Jobs (3), Controller (Admin), Views (index, create, edit). Remaining: User controller, market data viewer.

title: Phase 3: Analysis Layer - Migrate filter-strategy and ai-trading addons
description: Migrate filter-strategy-addon to filter-strategy module. Migrate ai-trading-addon to ai-analysis module. Ensure both use centralized MarketDataService. Update all dependencies and routes.
notes: Phase 3 50% complete: Migrated filter-strategy module (migration, model, IndicatorService, FilterStrategyEvaluator). KEY CHANGE: FilterStrategyEvaluator now uses centralized MarketDataService (eliminates duplicate data fetching). Remaining: AI migration, controllers, views.

title: Phase 4: Risk Layer - Merge preset and smart risk management
description: Migrate trading-preset-addon (presets) and smart-risk-management-addon (AI adaptive risk) into unified risk-management module. Create RiskCalculatorService that supports both manual presets and AI smart risk. Implement mode selection.

title: Phase 5: Execution Layer - Migrate execution engine and separate connections
description: Migrate trading-execution-engine-addon to execution + position-monitoring modules. Separate DataConnection (data fetching) from ExecutionConnection (trade execution). Update SignalObserver to use new architecture. Implement CCXT and mtapi.io adapters.

title: Phase 6: Social Layer - Migrate copy-trading addon
description: Migrate copy-trading-addon to copy-trading module. Integrate with unified execution module. Update listeners and jobs to use new event system. Test trade copying flow end-to-end.

title: Phase 7: UI Consolidation - Create tabbed interface
description: Create unified Trading Management structure with proper separation: 5 main menus (Trading Configuration submenu, Strategy Management submenu, Trading Operations with 5 tabs, Copy Trading submenu, Backtesting submenu). Update all views. Add redirects from old routes. Based on functionality, concern, and usage patterns.

title: Phase 8: Backtesting Module - Implement strategy backtesting (NEW)
description: Implement new backtesting module to test trading strategies on historical data. Create Backtest model, BacktestService, BacktestEngine, RunBacktestJob. Generate performance reports with win rate, profit factor, max drawdown. Admin/User UI for running backtests and viewing results.

title: Phase 9: Testing & Optimization - Comprehensive testing
description: Write unit tests (>80% coverage), feature tests, integration tests. Performance optimization (caching, query optimization, job queue). Security audit. Load testing. Bug fixes and stabilization.

title: Feature: Auto Language Translation on add
description: on manage languages menu, there should be an AI or auto translation tools, for adding new languages

title: Documentation: Trading Management Consolidation
description: Create comprehensive documentation: migration guide for users, API documentation for developers, video tutorials for new UI, architecture diagrams, troubleshooting guide. Update README.md with links to all docs.

title: EPIC: Centralize AI Connection Management
description: Refactor AI configuration from scattered implementations into a centralized AI Connection Addon. This will provide a single source of truth for all AI credentials, support credential rotation, rate limiting, and enable reuse across all platform features (parsing, translation, trading analysis).

title: Create AI Connection Addon structure
description: Create new addon with proper structure: addon.json, service provider, migrations, models, controllers, views, routes. Follow existing addon patterns.

title: Create database schema for AI connections
description: Create migrations for: ai_providers, ai_connections, ai_connection_usage tables. Include proper indexes, foreign keys, and encrypted credential storage.

title: Implement AI Provider models and services
description: Create models: AiProvider, AiConnection, AiConnectionUsage. Implement base service with credential encryption/decryption, connection validation.

title: Implement provider-specific adapters
description: Create adapters for OpenAI, OpenRouter, Gemini. Each adapter implements common interface with execute(), test(), methods. Handle provider-specific API calls.

title: Implement connection rotation and rate limiting
description: Build logic for automatic credential rotation when rate limits hit. Track usage per connection, implement priority-based selection, fallback to backup connections.

title: Create admin UI for AI connection management
description: Build admin pages: provider list, connection CRUD, test connection UI, usage analytics dashboard. Include status indicators, error logs, cost tracking.

title: Implement public API for consumer addons
description: Create AiConnectionService with methods: getAvailableConnections(), getNextConnection(), execute(), testConnection(), trackUsage(). Document API for consumers.

title: Migrate OpenRouter addon to AI Connection Addon
description: Refactor OpenRouter addon into AI Connection Addon as a provider type. Migrate existing OpenRouter configurations and credentials. Keep OpenRouter-specific features (model marketplace, routing).

title: Refactor Multi-Channel AI configuration schema
description: Create ai_parsing_profiles table to replace ai_configurations. Reference ai_connections instead of storing credentials. Create migration script to move existing data.

title: Update Multi-Channel parsing pipeline
description: Update AiMessageParser to use AI Connection Addon API instead of direct AI calls. Remove credential management code. Implement connection selection logic.

title: Update Multi-Channel admin UI for AI selection
description: Add AI connection dropdown in channel configuration. Add 'Create New Connection' button that redirects to AI Connection Addon. Add 'Test Parsing' button using selected connection.

title: Create translation settings table and UI
description: Create translation_settings table with ai_connection_id, fallback_connection_id. Build admin UI in Language Settings to select AI for translations, configure fallback, batch size, delays.

title: Refactor TranslationService to use AI Connection Addon
description: Update TranslationService to get connection from translation_settings instead of env config. Use AiConnectionService::execute() for API calls. Implement fallback connection logic. Remove hardcoded OpenAI code.

title: Update translation UI with connection status
description: Show which AI connection is configured for translations. Add test button. Show connection health status. Add link to AI Connection Addon for setup.

title: Refactor AI Trading addon to use centralized connections
description: Update ai_model_profiles to reference ai_connections instead of storing credentials. Create migration script. Update services to use AI Connection Addon API.

title: Update AI Trading admin UI
description: Update AI model profile CRUD to select from available connections instead of entering credentials. Add connection status indicators.

title: Test connection rotation and rate limiting
description: Write tests for: automatic rotation on rate limit, fallback to backup connections, priority-based selection, concurrent request handling. Test with mock API responses.

title: End-to-end testing of all consumer features
description: Test: Multi-Channel parsing, Auto translation, AI Trading analysis. Verify all work with centralized connections. Test edge cases: no connections, all connections failing, connection switching.

title: Update all documentation
description: Update: addon development guide, AI integration docs, admin user guide, API reference. Create migration guide for existing installations. Document connection rotation strategy.

title: Create data migration scripts
description: Build command to migrate existing AI credentials from all features to AI Connection Addon. Verify data integrity. Create rollback script. Test on staging first.

title: BUG: AiConnection recordError() uses stale error_count for threshold check
description: The recordError() method increments error_count in DB but checks threshold using pre-increment value from model property. This causes connections to never reach 'error' status even at 10+ errors. Critical for connection rotation and health monitoring.

title: BUG: AiConnection getCredentialsAttribute can return string instead of array
description: The getCredentialsAttribute method uses json_decode($decrypted, true) ?? $decrypted which returns raw string if JSON decode fails. But getCredential() assumes array, causing API keys to be lost when credentials stored as string. This breaks all API calls for connections with legacy/malformed credential data.
